value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tjb5WypK9P4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WEelCk04dYw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: SUM vs SUMX What is the Difference of the two DAX Functions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sum and Sumx are functions that often founded to be misleading for many Power BI users. As both functions are doing the aggregation, it seems a bit confusing what is the actual difference between these two. There are many blog posts and articles about each function. I always explain the difference with

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Blank row in DAX
value.excerpt: VALUES and DISTINCT are two functions that differ in how they could add a blank row to the result (or not). value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
value.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column. value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX
value.excerpt: Improve DAX queries by using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS when you create table expressions. value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #13: EARLIER

Link to pbix and excel file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/earlier-dax  EARLIER is mostly used in the context of calculated columns.  The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI.
